wikipedia_page.main:
Harrington Reynolds was an English actor who appeared on stage and in a number of movies.  He was best known for Old English (1930), Ride 'em, Cowgirl (1939) and Two Sinners (1935).
He started his own drama company.

response: | The Birth of New Zealand|| Harrington Reynolds || || Earliest New Zealand film of which footage (fragments only) are known to still exist.

Vera Pearce was appearing in the Tivoli Follies at the time. Harrington Reynolds had just appeared on stage in The Rosary. The Motion Picture News wrote during production that "I am off the opinion that it will be one of the usual war dramas. If so, it seems a pity to waste such talent as that possessed by Miss Pearce and Harrington Reynolds.""Film News from Foreign Parts", Motion Picture News 11 March 1916. Retrieved 23 November 1916

On 4n October 1921 she married New Zealand film director Harrington Reynolds in Auckland; she had starred for him in The Birth of New Zealand (1921). She also appeared in a number of productions on stage in Brisbane.Andrew Pike and Ross Cooper, Australian Film 1900–1977: A Guide to Feature Film Production, Melbourne: Oxford University Press, 1998, 100.

response: | The Murder of Captain Fryatt || John Gavin || Harrington Reynolds, John Gavin, Olive Proctor || Short || 26 February IMDb

The Birth of New Zealand is a 1922 New Zealand film which depicts key events in New Zealand history. Directed by Harrington Reynolds who also starred, other New Zealand pioneer filmmakers Ted Coubray and possibly Rudall Hayward were also involved. Episodes depicted include ancient Maori wars, Captain Cook's landing and the signing of the Treaty of Waitangi.
